author: Special Correspondent
text:
In a bid to purify the electoral rolls in the State, the Election Commission has called upon voters to voluntarily come forward to disclose repeat or multiple entries in the electoral rolls and repeat of Elector’s Photo Identity Card (EPIC) numbers.

Chief Electoral Officer Rajesh Lakhoni said that booth-level officers or Assistant Electoral Registration Officers of Electoral Registration Officers concerned can be informed of the details.

“Relatives and neighbours of dead persons are requested to apply for the deletion of such entries from the Electoral Rolls in Form 7 to the Electoral Registration Officer concerned,” he said.

The special drive to purify the electoral rolls would be held between February 15 and 26.

A list of dead electors would also be prepared and verified. “Suo motu deletion process as per Rule 22 of Registration of Electors Rules, 1960” is also scheduled between February 20 and 28.
title: Voters urged to report multiple entries
